subtitles.text: upfront group
Here we go... Up God!
This time I'll be talking with Ayumi Ishida of Morning Musume„ÄÇ 23's Ayumi Ishida and
Saori Onoda of Tsuboki Factory.
This show will take you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the up-front group.
This is a program that goes behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
Our recording, rehearsal, and other production processes.
We will show you the process of our recording and rehearsal.
First of all, let's take a look behind the scenes of our two MC's. I, Ishida, was at the Nippon Budokan for Morning Musume„ÄÇ 23 spring tour at Nippon Budokan,
In the spring, we performed the song "Here I am" at the very end of the tour.

And of course we were going to sing it at the Budokan as well, so I wondered how the seniors would feel about Morning Musume„ÄÇ I was wondering how the seniors had performed "Here I am" and I was looking for the past videos.
In that search, I came across a video of Tsunku III singing "Koko ni iruze" on youtube,
When I saw Tsunku III singing "Here I am," I felt that I was able to absorb more of the rhythms and nuances of his singing now than I had when I saw him sing it in the past,
I was very happy to see the changes in myself, and I was able to notice that my feelings toward rhythm have changed, even if only a little, which was a very pleasant discovery recently.
I see. It is wonderful to be able to make good changes, isn't it?
I would like to deepen my learning so that I can have the same kind of conversation three years from now.
I, Onoda, have recently had many opportunities to perform as Tsubaki Factory at outdoor summer festivals, and I am very happy to be able to do so,
I have often had the opportunity to see other artists perform at summer festivals, and many of the members have been inspired by their performances,
That is one of the reasons why I would like to continue to develop my passion and enthusiasm for summer festivals,
We have an open-air concert called "Burning Live" on August 24th,
Tsubaki's solo concert.
Yes, that's right. I would like to work hard for that outdoor concert.
There is definitely a kind of heat that only summer can bring, isn't there?
Yes, there is.
There is heat and we have our own heat, so we want to do our best while enjoying both.
We are looking forward to seeing Tsubaki Factory in summer.
Let's start with this up-date.

We hope you will watch it again and again.

Now that you have seen the VTR, I was thinking about it when I saw the music video, but I thought the way the Ochanooma members did so many cute hand gestures during the lip scene, which is unique to teenagers, was really cute.
The way they were all so determined.
I got the impression that the scenes where they are not singing are also very young, with a kind of "hmmm" feeling, which is a charm that only today's Ochanomama can bring out.
Yes, that's right. I could feel the fun in the making of the video, not only in the music video, but also during the filming, which made me enjoy watching it,
I could feel that they were having fun not only during the shoot, but also during the filming, which made me feel like I was having a lot of fun watching them.
It is true that the colors of the group have come through.
I am really looking forward to seeing more of the "Ocha-no-Oma" style in the future.
This is the making of the shooting of the music video for "Ochanoma Slightly Emotionally Unstable Summer".

My name is Hideki Nagamatsu, I play the electric bass.
Yes, this song has a fast tempo.
Rather than playing 8 minutes of "da-da-da-da-da"...
The 16th minute of this song was very important to me, so I had to play it in a different way.
So I made sure to play the 16 minutes in the right way.
The song also has a beautiful melody.
I made the bass line so that it wouldn't interfere with the song.I made a bass line so as not to disturb the song.
In the latter half of the song, I tried to make a phrase that is a little difficult to play.
It's not a challenge, but I did it in my own way.
First of all, I used a bass phrase in the A melody, which is related to the vocalist's voice.
There is a bass phrase in the A-melody that is related to the vocalist, and there is a lot of movement at the end of the song.
You might think it's too much, but I'm glad you enjoyed it.
I hope you enjoy it as well.
My name is Koga, and I was in charge of the music composition and arrangement.
It's fresh and catchy, but in fact, there are a lot of modulations and technical parts.
The arrangement is a little bit like Tsubaki, a little bit like Tsubaki Factory, a little bit like spring, with a sense of speed.
For the bass, I wanted it to sing, and I wanted it to play as if it were singing.
As for the guitar, I wanted it to be fast and furious, but at the same time, the lyrics are quite sad, so I asked the guitarist to incorporate that sadness into the melody and tone of the guitar.
The whole song has a lot of modulations, and you can feel the girl's emotions change along with the modulations, which is really great.

As you have seen in the bass recording, the song "Seventh Bloom Continues" is a song about a girl's sad and true feelings that she wants to say but can't. It is a song about the feelings that she hides in her heart.
It's a song about a girl's sad and hidden feelings that she really wants to say but can't. It's a perfect song for spring.

I can actually hear the bass sound in the chorus and the interlude. When I play live, I can hear the bass sound. So I think it is wonderful to hear only the bass, and it is also fun to hear the bass in the song, so I really like the way the bass matches the song.
I really like how you played the bass guitar as if you were singing at the end of the song, and I could really understand the melody line by listening to just the bass guitar.
I thought it was really comfortable and cool to listen to the bass, and the part where the chorus falls at the end and the excitement builds up once more... it's really cool!
The left hand! The left hand! It was amazing!
So fast! There was a great climax of the song.
It's true that the chorus after the fall chorus in the song is really made to get the audience excited.
When we perform, we always try to make the performance more exciting.
All the various instruments are working towards that goal.
So I could feel more than ever that everyone was really working together on the song.
It was so much fun! It was a lot of fun!
That's all for the bass recording of Tsubaki Factory Shichibunsaki!

It's time for a deep farewell from Ayumi Ishida and Saori Onoda.
We have seen various videos this time, but I, Onoda, saw the making-of video of the shooting of the music video for "Tea Horse.
I saw the making of the music video of Ocha-no-Ma, and I felt that the character of Ocha-no-Ma was very wonderful.
I hope that Tsubaki Factory will be able to bring out more of the Tsubaki Factory's character.
I, Ishida, really enjoyed watching the recording of Tsubaki Factory's songs with the bass player.
But I've never seen Morning Musume„ÄÇ But to be honest, there are not many times when the instrumental recordings of Morning Musume„ÄÇ
That's why I wanted to make it more interesting for the viewers.
In this Up-Kami, we will go behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Up-Front Group.
We'll introduce you to the parts you don't normally get to see, so please subscribe to our channel!
This time upcami will be with Ayumi Ishida of Morning Musume„ÄÇ 23's Ayumi Ishida and Tsubaki Factory's Saori Onoda.
